text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Coyoacán, Mexico City | settlement_type = Alcaldía | image_skyline = Mexico.DF.Coyoacan.JardinHidalgo.01.jpg | image_caption = Fountain depicting the drinking coyotes that gave the town its name at the Jardín Centenario | image_seal = | image_map = Coyoacán, México DF.svg | mapsize = 200px | map_caption = Coyoacán within Mexico City (CDMX) | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Federal entity | subdivision_name1 = Mexico City | seat = Jardín Hidalgo No. 1 Col. Villa Coyoacán, C.P. 04000 | leader_party = PAN | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Manuel Negrete Arias | established_title = Established | established_date = 1928 | named_for = Pre-Columbian city | area_total_km2 = 54.12 | area_footnotes = | population_total = 620416 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_footnotes = 2010 2010 census tables: INEGI | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 2256 | elevation_max_m = 2420 | timezone = Central Standard Time | utc_offset = -6 | timezone_DST = Central Daylight Time | utc_offset_DST = -5 | postal_code_type = Postal codes | postal_code = 04000–04980 | area_code = 55 | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2010) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.932 Very High | website = }} Coyoacán ( , ) is a municipality (alcaldía) of Mexico City. In 1928, the borough was created when the Federal District was divided into sixteen boroughs. Coyoacán is a Sister City of Arlington County, Virginia, United States. It has also been a sister city of Clifden, County Galway, Ireland since 2012. ==References== Category:Municipalities of Mexico City
title: Coyoacán
